answers.answer: Have you done the cystic fibrosis or spina bifida tests?  And your test for Gestational diabetes should be soon.
Just wanted to say how happy I am that your boys are doing so well.  Congrats!!!
That must be so exciting!!! Congrats!!I'm not sure what all tests they do with twins.. not sure if it's the same as a singleton.

question: Hello Ladies,Yesterday i had my level 2 u/s and it was the most amazing thing.  Firts of all I was very glad to hear that both babies are doing great.  But the details that the doc showed us were just amazing.  He looked at everything: head, heart, kidneys, stomach, measured bones looked at little hands and feet.  And at the end even gave us a 3D show of each of babies face.  Unbelievable.I'm 21w3d, babies were measuring 20w4d and 20w5d and weighted 12 and 13 oz.  The doc said that it's perfectly normal.  They each are proportionate to their own bodies.  And they confirmed that they are both boys.My question to you: what other tests are normally performed in the 2nd trimester.  I feel like I don't need an OB app just yet since we saw them yesterday, but I don't want to miss any important milestones.  I guess I can always call the doc to find out, but I don't want them making appts just for the heck of it.
title: My update after Level 2 u/s
